intro: Microphacos microlobus, commonly known as the small-lobed microphacos, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in umbels. It is native to parts of southern Africa, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils. Due to its delicate appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
